chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall x n : nat, n > 0 -> {y : nat | x = power y n} + {forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> x * power b n <> power a n}

Premises:
power = fix power (x n : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 1 | S n0 => x * power x n0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments power (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
nth_root_irrat : forall p k a b n r : nat, is_prime p -> rel_prime p k -> 0 < r -> r < n -> b <> 0 -> power p r * k * power b n <> power a n
nth_root_irrational : forall p k a b n q r : nat, is_prime p -> rel_prime p k -> 0 < r -> r < n -> b <> 0 -> power p (q * n + r) * k * power b n <> power a n
nth_root_irrat_aux : forall p k a b n r : nat, is_prime p -> rel_prime p k -> 0 < r -> r < n -> rel_prime a b -> power p r * k * power b n <> power a n
power_mult_lemma1 : forall n x y : nat, power (x * y) n = power x n * power y n
mult_lemma6 : forall a b n : nat, n <> 0 -> n * a = n * b -> a = b
power_zero : forall n x : nat, power x n = 0 -> x = 0
power_plus_lemma1 : forall n m x : nat, power x (n + m) = power x n * power x m
power_power_lemma1 : forall n m x : nat, power (power x n) m = power x (n * m)
euclide.divides_le : forall a b : nat, a <> 0 -> divides a b -> b <= a
wf_power_dec : forall (n : nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), is_wf l -> n > 0 -> {x : nat | refactor l = power x n} + {p : nat & {q : nat & {r : nat & {k : nat | is_prime p /\ 0 < r /\ r < n /\ refactor l = power p (q * n + r) * k /\ rel_prime p k}}}}
euclide.euclide : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | a = b * q + r /\ r < b}}
nat_factor_prime : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> n <> 1 -> {p : nat & {m : nat & {q : nat | is_prime p /\ m > 0 /\ n = power p m * q /\ is_gcd 1 p q /\ q < n}}}
power_power_rel_prime : forall a n b m : nat, n > 0 -> m > 0 -> rel_prime (power a n) (power b m) < -> rel_prime a b
is_power_m_dec : forall n m : nat, m > 0 -> {x : nat | n = power x m} + {p : nat & {q : nat & {r : nat & {k : nat | is_prime p /\ 0 < r /\ r < m /\ n = power p (q * m + r) * k /\ rel_prime p k}}}}
euclide.dec_impl_lt_dec : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, {P n} + {~ P n}) -> forall m : nat, {n : nat | n < m /\ P n} + {forall n : nat, n < m -> ~ P n}
euclide.remainder_euclide : nat -> forall b : nat, b <> 0 -> nat
euclide.quotient_euclide : nat -> forall b : nat, b <> 0 -> nat
euclide.divides_nat : forall n : nat, {p : nat | p <> 1 /\ p <> n /\ divides n p} + {forall p : nat, p <> 1 -> p <> n -> ~ divides n p}
quo_dec : forall a b : nat, divides a b -> {q : nat | a = b * q}
minus_lt_lemma1 : forall b a : nat, a < b -> 0 < b - a
mult_lemma3 : forall n m : nat, n <> 0 -> m > 1 -> n < n * m
power_divides_lemma1 : forall n x : nat, 0 < n -> divides (power x n) x
euclide.quo_rem_euclide : forall (a b : nat) (H : b <> 0), a = b * euclide.quotient_euclide a b H + euclide.remainder_euclide a b H
divides_antisym : forall a b : nat, divides a b -> divides b a -> a = b
factorisation_exists : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> {l : list (nat * nat) | is_factorisation n l}
power_one : forall n : nat, power 1 n = 1
quo : forall a b : nat, divides a b -> nat
bezout_exists_prod : forall x : nat * nat, {y : nat * nat | is_gcd (fst y * fst x - snd y * snd x) (fst x) (snd x)} + {y : nat * nat | is_gcd (snd y * snd x - fst y * fst x) (fst x) (snd x)}
gcd_rel_prime : forall (d a b : nat) (H : is_gcd d a b), d <> 0 -> rel_prime (quo a d (gcd_div_l d a b H)) (quo b d (gcd_div_r d a b H))
O_or_S : forall n : nat, {m : nat | S m = n} + {0 = n}

```coq
intros x n.
case (wf_power_dec n ((1, x))) as [|[p [q [r [k [H1 [H2 [H3 H4]]]]]]].
- right. exists p. exists q. exists r. exists k. repeat split; eauto.
- left. exists (power x n). repeat split; eauto.
Qed.```
